channel.title: Wikimedia Design Strategy
channel.description: Design and user research projects at Wikimedia Foundation.

item.title: User Engagement with the Wikipedia App Explore Feed
item.description: A mixed-method study examining perceptions of the Wikipedia Explore Feed and opportunities to improve engagement.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Sentiment & Perception

A mixed-method study examining perceptions of the Wikipedia Explore Feed and opportunities to improve engagement.

Lead: Bethany Gerdemann with Michael Raish and the Apps team
item.author: Bethany Gerdemann with Michael Raish and the Apps team

item.title: Mapping non-emergency support structures
item.description: Documenting local help and support structures, especially for conflict resolution, across four wikis to inform recommendations for the Incident Reporting System.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Online Social Behavior

Documenting local help and support structures, especially for conflict resolution, across four wikis to inform recommendations for the Incident Reporting System.

Lead: Claudia Lo with Katie Coleman, for the Product Safety and Integrity team
item.author: Claudia Lo with Katie Coleman, for the Product Safety and Integrity team

item.title: Understanding User Needs for Deep Reading
item.description: Understanding the "deep reading" experience on Wikipedia, to inform improvements to the reading experience, particularly around discovery and search.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Sentiment & Perception

Understanding the "deep reading" experience on Wikipedia, to inform improvements to the reading experience, particularly around discovery and search.

Lead: Tara Rooks with Viviana Ortiz, Eli Asikin-Garmager, and Debra Kumar for the Readers team
item.author: Tara Rooks with Viviana Ortiz, Eli Asikin-Garmager, and Debra Kumar for the Readers team

item.title: Centralized Contributions for Moderation
item.description: Discover if experienced editors want a centralized hub to discover and find new contribution suggestions, and if so, what should be on it to encourage its use.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Powered by People

Discover if experienced editors want a centralized hub to discover and find new contribution suggestions, and if so, what should be on it to encourage its use.

Lead: Claudia Lo, Jahnavi Mirashi for the Moderator Tools Team
item.author: Claudia Lo, Jahnavi Mirashi for the Moderator Tools Team

item.title: Watchlist and Task Prioritization
item.description: Understanding how moderators and patrollers use their watchlist page and how they discover, organize and prioritize their on-wiki work.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Powered by People

Understanding how moderators and patrollers use their watchlist page and how they discover, organize and prioritize their on-wiki work.

Lead: Daisy Chen for the Moderator Tools Team
item.author: Daisy Chen for the Moderator Tools Team

item.content:encoded:

Conversations with 4 readers and 1 editors about the Editing team's upcoming Peacock Check feature in Visual Editor.

item.title: Reading and Editing in the iOS Wikipedia App
item.description: This study explores how English and Japanese Wikipedia app users engage with reading and editing, to inform future improvements to the iOS app experience.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Sentiment & Perception

This study explores how English and Japanese Wikipedia app users engage with reading and editing, to inform future improvements to the iOS app experience.

item.title: Understanding the usage and impact of the Flagged Revisions extension
item.description: As part of the Research group, the Design Research team supports Product Design by delivering insights that help product teams make informed and inspired decisions.
item.content:encoded:

Lead: Claudia Lo, Tara Rooks for the Moderator Tools Team

item.description: Design, distribute, and analyze a survey of WikiProject contributors in order to identify projects for impact.
item.content:encoded:

Design, distribute, and analyze a survey of WikiProject contributors in order to identify projects for impact.

Lead: Michael Raish and Alex Stinson for the Campaigns team

item.title: Wikipedia Administrator Experiences
item.description: Causes behind human administration recruiting, retention, and departure patterns.
item.content:encoded:

Causes behind human administration recruiting, retention, and departure patterns.

Lead: Eli Asikin-Garmager, Yu-Ming Liou, Claudia Lo, Caroline Myrick, with Bethany Gerdemann and Daisy Chen
item.author: Eli Asikin-Garmager, Yu-Ming Liou, Claudia Lo, Caroline Myrick, with Bethany Gerdemann and Daisy Chen

item.title: Volunteer Archetypes V2
item.description: While V1 Archetypes research engaged with both off-Wiki volunteer contributors and previous research conducted by the WMF, V2 intends to provide a strong empirical basis for Archetypes by expanding the size and number of populations engaged.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Numeric Exploration

While V1 Archetypes research engaged with both off-Wiki volunteer contributors and previous research conducted by the WMF, V2 intends to provide a strong empirical basis for Archetypes by expanding the size and number of populations engaged.

Lead: Michael Raish, Tanja Andic, Sneha Patel, and Rita Ho
item.author: Michael Raish, Tanja Andic, Sneha Patel, and Rita Ho

item.title: Wikipedia is an Antidote to Disinformation
item.description: Literature review highlighting the place of Wikipedia as a key part of the internet information ecosystem, in the fight against disinformation.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Research & Development

Literature review highlighting the place of Wikipedia as a key part of the internet information ecosystem, in the fight against disinformation.

item.author: Claudia Lo, Martin Gerlach, Pablo Aragón, Diego Saez-Trumper, Leila Zia for the Global Advocacy Team

item.title: Volunteer Archetypes V1
item.description: Using survey methods, this project builds archetypes of non-Wikimedian volunteer internet contributors in order to support strategic decisions about whom to target for recruitment into the Movement.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Numeric Exploration

Using survey methods, this project builds archetypes of non-Wikimedian volunteer internet contributors in order to support strategic decisions about whom to target for recruitment into the Movement.

item.title: Cross-Wiki Uploads
item.description: User interviews of English and Arabic Wiki uploaders were conducted to understand the experience and mindsets of those who use the visual editor upload tool, and what leads them to upload copyrighted material.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Sentiment & Perception

User interviews of English and Arabic Wiki uploaders were conducted to understand the experience and mindsets of those who use the visual editor upload tool, and what leads them to upload copyrighted material.

item.author: Bethany Gerdemann with Eman Yahia for the Structured Content team

item.title: Wikipedia Subscription
item.description: User research to study the reading and information seeking habits of internet users, and their usage of subscription services, to help inform products that can deliver Wikipedia content in novel formats.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Research & Development

User research to study the reading and information seeking habits of internet users, and their usage of subscription services, to help inform products that can deliver Wikipedia content in novel formats.

item.author: Gabriel Escalante and Purity Waigi, for the Inuka Team

item.description: Variant testing in English, Arabic, German, and Chinese for a redesign the iOS navigation system with the goal of ensuring a seamless user experience.
item.content:encoded:

Variant testing in English, Arabic, German, and Chinese for a redesign the iOS navigation system with the goal of ensuring a seamless user experience.

item.title: MinT (Machine in Translation) Research
item.description: The goal of this project was to understand how to better leverage MinT to support more readers and contributors in their aims of accessing, interacting with, and contributing to Wikipedia content, as well as knowledge more generally.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Machine Augmentation

The goal of this project was to understand how to better leverage MinT to support more readers and contributors in their aims of accessing, interacting with, and contributing to Wikipedia content, as well as knowledge more generally.

item.author: Mike Raish with Naoko Sato, and the Growth & Core Experiences teams

item.title: Future Learning Vectors
item.description: Interviews with educational, short-form video content creators about how, when, and why they use Wikipedia, in order to improve the quality and quantity of Wikipedia content that is disseminated to global audiences through learning-oriented video content.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Research & Development

Interviews with educational, short-form video content creators about how, when, and why they use Wikipedia, in order to improve the quality and quantity of Wikipedia content that is disseminated to global audiences through learning-oriented video content.

item.author: Mike Raish, with Shobha S V and the Core Experiences teams

item.title: Trust & Wikipedia
item.description: An experiment to determine how embedding "trust signals" into the Wikipedia desktop interface affects understanding of how Wikipedia works and trust in its information.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Research & Development

An experiment to determine how embedding "trust signals" into the Wikipedia desktop interface affects understanding of how Wikipedia works and trust in its information.

Lead: Mike Raish, with Laura Stigliano and the Web team
item.author: Mike Raish, with Laura Stigliano and the Web team

item.description: This project explores what and whether notable moments cause users to deepen and expand their use of and/or contributions to Wikipedia.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Powered by People

This project explores what and whether notable moments cause users to deepen and expand their use of and/or contributions to Wikipedia.

Lead: Daisy Chen with Mike Raish and the Core Experiences product group
item.author: Daisy Chen with Mike Raish and the Core Experiences product group

item.title: Reading Wikipedia
item.description: Understanding what readers in diverse language communities think they are doing as they read Wikipedia, their motivations for reading, the navigational structures they perceive and use, and the ways in which they interact with information.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Sentiment & Perception

Understanding what readers in diverse language communities think they are doing as they read Wikipedia, their motivations for reading, the navigational structures they perceive and use, and the ways in which they interact with information.

item.author: Mike Raish with YUX for the Core Experiences product group

item.description: Developing a better understanding of the challenges users face when creating and updating translatable pages in order to improve the user experience.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Machine Augmentation

Developing a better understanding of the challenges users face when creating and updating translatable pages in order to improve the user experience.

item.author: Eli Asikin-Garmager, and the Language Team

item.description: Usability tests for a feature that suggests images to experienced contributors to add to an article section.
item.content:encoded:

Usability tests for a feature that suggests images to experienced contributors to add to an article section.

Lead: Daisy Chen, with the Structured Content team
item.author: Daisy Chen, with the Structured Content team

item.title: New Page Patrollers
item.description: An interview series with English Wikipedia New Page Patrollers to develop a shared understanding of how new page patrolling works on the English Wikipedia and to identify potential areas for improvement grounded in today’s patrolling practices.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Sentiment & Perception

An interview series with English Wikipedia New Page Patrollers to develop a shared understanding of how new page patrolling works on the English Wikipedia and to identify potential areas for improvement grounded in today’s patrolling practices.

Lead: Claudia Lo, with the Moderator Tools team
item.author: Claudia Lo, with the Moderator Tools team

item.title: Wikistories Early Adopters Research
item.description: A project about Wikistory adopters, both creators and readers, focusing on their motivations and experiences creating and sharing stories.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Powered by People

A project about Wikistory adopters, both creators and readers, focusing on their motivations and experiences creating and sharing stories.

Lead: Eli Asikin-Garmager and Claudia Lo
item.author: Eli Asikin-Garmager and Claudia Lo

item.title: Momentum: Contribution, Content, & Reading in Wiki Growth
item.description: This study test some key hypotheses: that building awareness of the brand drives more people to read our content; that by growing readership the Movement itself grows as readers are converted into content contributors; that as the community grows so does the amount and diversity of content offered; and that more, and more diverse, content attracts more readers.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Numeric Exploration

This study test some key hypotheses: that building awareness of the brand drives more people to read our content; that by growing readership the Movement itself grows as readers are converted into content contributors; that as the community grows so does the amount and diversity of content offered; and that more, and more diverse, content attracts more readers.

Lead: Jim Maddock with Michael Raish, Mikhail Popov, Isaac Johnson, and Margeigh Novotny
item.author: Jim Maddock with Michael Raish, Mikhail Popov, Isaac Johnson, and Margeigh Novotny

item.title: IP Editing on Japanese Wikipedia
item.description: An inquiry into why some editors don’t log in and how they might be encouraged to through a comparative study of Arabic, Bengali, Spanish, and Japanese Wikipedias.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Online Social Behavior

An inquiry into why some editors don’t log in and how they might be encouraged to through a comparative study of Arabic, Bengali, Spanish, and Japanese Wikipedias.

item.author: Michael Raish and the Growth team

item.content:encoded:

Lead: Eli Asikin-Garmager with the Language team
item.author: Eli Asikin-Garmager with the Language team

item.title: Special Search Improvements: Spanish User Testing
item.description: When someone searches on Wikipedia but there isn’t an article matching their search term, they arrive at “special:search,”. This project tests new concepts for this feature with Spanish readers.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Sentiment & Perception

When someone searches on Wikipedia but there isn’t an article matching their search term, they arrive at “special:search,”. This project tests new concepts for this feature with Spanish readers.

item.author: Mike Raish, Daisy Chen, Sneha Patel, UserTestingArabic, and Criba Research

item.description: When someone searches on Wikipedia but there isn’t an article matching their search term, they arrive at “special:search,”. This project tests new concepts for this feature with Arabic readers.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Sentiment & Perception

When someone searches on Wikipedia but there isn’t an article matching their search term, they arrive at “special:search,”. This project tests new concepts for this feature with Arabic readers.

Lead: Mike Raish, Daisy Chen, Sneha Patel, UserTestingArabic, and Criba Research
item.author: Mike Raish, Daisy Chen, Sneha Patel, UserTestingArabic, and Criba Research

item.title: Templates and Trust-o-meters: Towards a widely deployable indicator of trust in Wikipedia
item.description: This work identifies three key challenges: 1) empirically determining which metrics from community approaches most impact reader trust; 2) validating indicator placements and designs; and 3) demonstrating that such indicators can both lower trust and increase perceived trust in the system when appropriate.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Numeric Exploration

This work identifies three key challenges: 1) empirically determining which metrics from community approaches most impact reader trust; 2) validating indicator placements and designs; and 3) demonstrating that such indicators can both lower trust and increase perceived trust in the system when appropriate.

Lead: Andrew Kuznetsov, Margeigh Novotny, Jessica Klein, Diego Saez-Trumper, Aniket Kittur
item.author: Andrew Kuznetsov, Margeigh Novotny, Jessica Klein, Diego Saez-Trumper, Aniket Kittur

A collaboration between the WMF and the Berkman Klein Center for Internet and Society to research the internet habits, preferences, and beliefs of youth across Latin America.

item.author: Taryn Bipat

item.title: Content Moderation in Medium-Sized Wikimedia Projects
item.description: This project aims to fill knowledge gaps in our understanding of how editors curate and moderate content on Wikimedia projects outside the largest and most well-researched communities.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Powered by People

This project aims to fill knowledge gaps in our understanding of how editors curate and moderate content on Wikimedia projects outside the largest and most well-researched communities.

item.title: Event Organizers: A Study in 4 African Countries
item.description: This exploratory research project focused on organizations in four african countries to learn about the particular challenges faced event organizers and the strategies they have developed to succeed in growing their communities.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Powered by People

This exploratory research project focused on organizations in four african countries to learn about the particular challenges faced event organizers and the strategies they have developed to succeed in growing their communities.

item.author: YUX with the Campaigns team

item.title: Section Translation Post Improvements Testing
item.description: Section Translation brings translation support to mobile device editors, and this project provided usability testing after a number of initial tool improvements and at a time when it was becoming available in a greater number of wikis, including Thai Wikipedia.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Machine Augmentation

Section Translation brings translation support to mobile device editors, and this project provided usability testing after a number of initial tool improvements and at a time when it was becoming available in a greater number of wikis, including Thai Wikipedia.

item.title: Wikistories Africa Research
item.description: This work provides a method for visualizing and comparing topical coverage from one wiki project to another for the purpose of better understanding where knowledge gaps and subject matter expertise exist across the Free Knowledge Movement.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Research & Development

This work provides a method for visualizing and comparing topical coverage from one wiki project to another for the purpose of better understanding where knowledge gaps and subject matter expertise exist across the Free Knowledge Movement.

item.title: Wikistories Indonesia Concept Testing
item.description: The goal of this project was to collaborate with Wikimedia Indonesia and gather feedback from Indonesian wiki editor communities on early concepts and designs for WikiStories, focusing on the experience of potential WikiStory creators.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Research & Development

The goal of this project was to collaborate with Wikimedia Indonesia and gather feedback from Indonesian wiki editor communities on early concepts and designs for WikiStories, focusing on the experience of potential WikiStory creators.

item.author: Eli Asikin-Garmager, with Ari Natarina.

Understanding the wiki-related communications ecosystem, both on and off Wiki, that embedded community members employ for their Wiki related work.

Lead: Daisy Chen, with the Growth and Editing teams
item.author: Daisy Chen, with the Growth and Editing teams

item.title: Section Translation Entry Points
item.description: Improving discoverability of translation tools on Wikipedia.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Machine Augmentation

Improving discoverability of translation tools on Wikipedia.

Lead: Eli Asikin-Garmager, with Pau Giner, Anagram Research, and the Language team
item.author: Eli Asikin-Garmager, with Pau Giner, Anagram Research, and the Language team

item.title: Digital Spaces // Topical Neighborhoods
item.description: This project combined conversations with WMF employees and global volunteers with a literature review to support the internal conversation around the Digital Spaces // Topical Neighborhoods proposal.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Online Social Behavior

This project combined conversations with WMF employees and global volunteers with a literature review to support the internal conversation around the Digital Spaces // Topical Neighborhoods proposal.

Lead: Michael Raish
item.author: Michael Raish

item.title: Media Matching
item.description: Conducted in support of the WMF Structured Data team, Media Matching attempted to identify barriers faced by experienced editors in English, Arabic, and Japanese Wikipedias.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Research & Development

Conducted in support of the WMF Structured Data team, Media Matching attempted to identify barriers faced by experienced editors in English, Arabic, and Japanese Wikipedias.

Lead: Michael Raish, with the Structured Data team, Community Ambassadors and Project Kobo
item.author: Michael Raish, with the Structured Data team, Community Ambassadors and Project Kobo

item.title: Targets of Harassment
item.description: In order to support the Universal Code of Conduct’s phase 2 drafting committee, the Wikimedia Foundation has conducted a research project focused on experiences of harassment on Wikimedia projects.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Online Social Behavior

In order to support the Universal Code of Conduct’s phase 2 drafting committee, the Wikimedia Foundation has conducted a research project focused on experiences of harassment on Wikimedia projects.

Lead: Claudia Lo, with the Anti-Harassment Tools team
item.author: Claudia Lo, with the Anti-Harassment Tools team

item.title: Wikimail Harassment
item.description: An analysis of community initiatives regarding Wikimail abuse over the past five years and general perspectives on harassment.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Online Social Behavior

An analysis of community initiatives regarding Wikimail abuse over the past five years and general perspectives on harassment.

Lead: Jeff Howard
item.author: Jeff Howard

item.title: Long Tail Topic & Influence Ontology
item.description: This work provides a method for visualizing and comparing topical coverage from one wiki project to another for the purpose of better understanding where knowledge gaps and subject matter expertise exist across the Free Knowledge Movement.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Numeric Exploration

This work provides a method for visualizing and comparing topical coverage from one wiki project to another for the purpose of better understanding where knowledge gaps and subject matter expertise exist across the Free Knowledge Movement.

item.title: Understanding Perspectives on Digital Education in African Contexts
item.description: Qualitative research examining the perspectives on the future of education from experts, students, teachers, and parents.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Powered by People

Qualitative research examining the perspectives on the future of education from experts, students, teachers, and parents.

Lead: Ana Chang, with AfriqInsights
item.author: Ana Chang, with AfriqInsights

item.title: Verifiability on Wikipedia
item.description: This three-language study provides foundational understanding for how editors work with available resources to meet the standards required for article quality.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Sentiment & Perception

This three-language study provides foundational understanding for how editors work with available resources to meet the standards required for article quality.

Lead: Ana Chang, with Sam Walton (WMF), Spiegel Institut, and Wikipedia Library team
item.author: Ana Chang, with Sam Walton (WMF), Spiegel Institut, and Wikipedia Library team

item.title: WikiFunctions, phases 1 & 2
item.description: A study that collects feedback on the function-builder prototype from technical users, nontechnical users, and those from outside of the Wikimedia ecosystem.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Research & Development

A study that collects feedback on the function-builder prototype from technical users, nontechnical users, and those from outside of the Wikimedia ecosystem.

item.title: Section Translation Usability Testing
item.description: Many Wikipedia contributors edit articles via mobile devices. Section Translation brings translation support to mobile device editors, and this project provided usability testing as the tool became available in the first wiki.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Machine Augmentation

Many Wikipedia contributors edit articles via mobile devices. Section Translation brings translation support to mobile device editors, and this project provided usability testing as the tool became available in the first wiki.

Lead: Eli Asikin-Garmager, with the Language team
item.author: Eli Asikin-Garmager, with the Language team

item.title: Table of Contents & Sticky Header
item.description: This project tests the concept of a sticky header and the table of contents element as a part of a reader-focused desktop interface improvement initiative by the Web team.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Sentiment & Perception

This project tests the concept of a sticky header and the table of contents element as a part of a reader-focused desktop interface improvement initiative by the Web team.

Lead: Daisy Chen, with Criba Research, Urika Research, and Monafina F Silitonga
item.author: Daisy Chen, with Criba Research, Urika Research, and Monafina F Silitonga

item.title: Wikifunctions, phases 1 & 2
item.description: A study that collects feedback on the function-builder prototype from technical users, nontechnical users, and those from outside of the Wikimedia ecosystem.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: undefined

A study that collects feedback on the function-builder prototype from technical users, nontechnical users, and those from outside of the Wikimedia ecosystem.

Lead: Jeff Howard
item.author: Jeff Howard

item.title: Taxonomy of Harassment
item.description: A taxonomy of negative social interactions on Wiki projects and a methodology to prioritize those in need of intervention.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Online Social Behavior

A taxonomy of negative social interactions on Wiki projects and a methodology to prioritize those in need of intervention.

Lead: Claudia Lo, with the Anti-Harassment Tools team
item.author: Claudia Lo, with the Anti-Harassment Tools team

item.title: Decision-making & Influence
item.description: A collaboration to map the different types of group decision-making required to manage and improve a crowd-sourced content platform like Wikipedia and understand contributor communities as discrete social groups.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Research & Development

A collaboration to map the different types of group decision-making required to manage and improve a crowd-sourced content platform like Wikipedia and understand contributor communities as discrete social groups.

item.title: Usability of the Wikipedia KaiOS app
item.description: This research evaluates usability and user understanding of the basic app elements and workflows for the Wikipedia KaiOS app.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Sentiment & Perception

This research evaluates usability and user understanding of the basic app elements and workflows for the Wikipedia KaiOS app.

Lead: Daisy Chen, with Hureo and the Inuka team
item.author: Daisy Chen, with Hureo and the Inuka team

item.title: Multilingual Editor Experiences in Small Wikis
item.description: Supporting multilingual editors in small Wikipedias who are leveraging translation to contribute across knowledge and content gaps.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Machine Augmentation

Supporting multilingual editors in small Wikipedias who are leveraging translation to contribute across knowledge and content gaps.

Lead: Eli Asikin-Garmager, with Anagram Research and the Language team
item.author: Eli Asikin-Garmager, with Anagram Research and the Language team

item.title: Patrolling Anonymous Edits
item.description: A study of how patrollers handle edits by logged-out users, and what pieces of information from IP addresses are necessary for their work in maintaining the overall health and quality of Wikimedia projects.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Online Social Behavior

A study of how patrollers handle edits by logged-out users, and what pieces of information from IP addresses are necessary for their work in maintaining the overall health and quality of Wikimedia projects.

Lead: Claudia Lo, with the Anti-Harassment Tools team
item.author: Claudia Lo, with the Anti-Harassment Tools team

item.title: CheckUser Improvements
item.description: Past research and Steward feedback surfaced many pain points in the CheckUser extension, the tool used by moderators to reverse vandalism of articles. These are multiple iterative rounds of usability tests of the enhanced tool.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Online Social Behavior

Past research and Steward feedback surfaced many pain points in the CheckUser extension, the tool used by moderators to reverse vandalism of articles. These are multiple iterative rounds of usability tests of the enhanced tool.

Lead: Claudia Lo, with the Anti-Harassment Tools team
item.author: Claudia Lo, with the Anti-Harassment Tools team

item.title: Trusted: Signals, Inferences & Indicators
item.description: The goal of this work is to develop systems for automatically detecting and characterizing the editorial debates behind Wikipedia articles for the purpose of surfacing indications of trustworthiness to the reader. This project is a collaboration between the Wikimedia Foundation and the CMU Human Computer Interaction Institute.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Numeric Exploration

The goal of this work is to develop systems for automatically detecting and characterizing the editorial debates behind Wikipedia articles for the purpose of surfacing indications of trustworthiness to the reader. This project is a collaboration between the Wikimedia Foundation and the CMU Human Computer Interaction Institute.

Lead: Andrew Kuznetsov of the Carnegie Mellon Human Computer Interaction Institute, with Margeigh Novotny
item.author: Andrew Kuznetsov of the Carnegie Mellon Human Computer Interaction Institute, with Margeigh Novotny

item.title: Trusted: Signals, Inferences & Indicators
item.description: Researchers are analyzing which types of cues work best to help readers understand the true quality of an article and scraping talk pages for the signals and inferences that can drive these cues.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Research & Development

Researchers are analyzing which types of cues work best to help readers understand the true quality of an article and scraping talk pages for the signals and inferences that can drive these cues.

item.title: Content Moderation Explained
item.description: An overview of how a global community of volunteer moderators determine which contributions to Wikipedia are accepted and rejected.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Powered by People

An overview of how a global community of volunteer moderators determine which contributions to Wikipedia are accepted and rejected.

item.title: How Do News Organizations Use Wikipedia?
item.description: A literature review that seeks to understand more about how and why media and news organizations use Wikipedia.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Powered by People

A literature review that seeks to understand more about how and why media and news organizations use Wikipedia.

Lead: Anna Rader
item.author: Anna Rader

item.title: Interpersonal Communication on Wikipedia
item.description: A review of the available academic literature on interpersonal communication and coordination within the Wikipedia community, in particular the role of talk pages in creating and maintaining Wikipedia’s content.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Online Social Behavior

A review of the available academic literature on interpersonal communication and coordination within the Wikipedia community, in particular the role of talk pages in creating and maintaining Wikipedia’s content.

Lead: Anna Rader
item.author: Anna Rader

item.title: Content Moderation Explained
item.description: An overview of how a global community of volunteer moderators determine which contributions to Wikipedia are accepted and rejected.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Online Social Behavior

An overview of how a global community of volunteer moderators determine which contributions to Wikipedia are accepted and rejected.

Lead: Claudia Lo, with Lucy Blackwell
item.author: Claudia Lo, with Lucy Blackwell

item.title: Machine Translation Meets Human Perception
item.description: The Machine Translation Meets Human Perception (MTMHP) study developed a protocol for evaluating how readers perceive and evaluate machine-translated content - across three different languages, cultural contexts, and content domains.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Machine Augmentation

The Machine Translation Meets Human Perception (MTMHP) study developed a protocol for evaluating how readers perceive and evaluate machine-translated content - across three different languages, cultural contexts, and content domains.

Lead: Michael Raish, with Hureo and Bethany Gerdemann
item.author: Michael Raish, with Hureo and Bethany Gerdemann

item.title: Android App Suggested Edits
item.description: This project addresses user difficulties using and understanding the Contributions screens as part of the Section Editing feature.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Sentiment & Perception

This project addresses user difficulties using and understanding the Contributions screens as part of the Section Editing feature.

Lead: Daisy Chen, with the Android App Team
item.author: Daisy Chen, with the Android App Team

item.title: Free Knowledge Movement Personas
item.description: This is a collection of all personas developed to date for desktop and mobile readers, new and veteran contributors, institutional curators and Movement organizers.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Powered by People

This is a collection of all personas developed to date for desktop and mobile readers, new and veteran contributors, institutional curators and Movement organizers.

item.title: CheckUser Workflow & Tools
item.description: CheckUser is a critical tool for moderators in anti-vandalism efforts on Wikipedia. This research surfaces the pain points in the CheckUser workflow and opportunities to improve the tool.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Powered by People

CheckUser is a critical tool for moderators in anti-vandalism efforts on Wikipedia. This research surfaces the pain points in the CheckUser workflow and opportunities to improve the tool.

Lead: Claudia Lo, with the Anti-Harassment Tools team
item.author: Claudia Lo, with the Anti-Harassment Tools team

item.title: Content Translation Newcomer Survey
item.description: A customizable survey that can be used to easily, quickly, and reliably collect feedback from a more diverse pool of Content Translation users.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Machine Augmentation

A customizable survey that can be used to easily, quickly, and reliably collect feedback from a more diverse pool of Content Translation users.

Lead: Eli Asikin-Garmager, with Pau Giner and Amir E. Aharoni
item.author: Eli Asikin-Garmager, with Pau Giner and Amir E. Aharoni

item.title: Article Section Translation Study
item.description: An evaluation of new designs for tools that help editors translate article sections and receive translation support on mobile devices.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Machine Augmentation

An evaluation of new designs for tools that help editors translate article sections and receive translation support on mobile devices.

Lead: Eli Asikin-Garmager, with the Language team and Pau Giner
item.author: Eli Asikin-Garmager, with the Language team and Pau Giner

item.title: Why Do People Edit Wikipedia?
item.description: This literature review examines the drivers of engagement and the motivators of sustained involvement in Wikipedia. It provides an overview of academic research on Wikipedia production and editor motivations, highlighting the themes and queries of scholarship in this area.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Powered by People

This literature review examines the drivers of engagement and the motivators of sustained involvement in Wikipedia. It provides an overview of academic research on Wikipedia production and editor motivations, highlighting the themes and queries of scholarship in this area.

Lead: Anna Rader
item.author: Anna Rader

item.title: WMF Remote Worker Experience
item.description: This is a lean, inward-facing research project that surfaced the challenges and highlights of working remotely for the Foundation and offered opportunities for the Foundation and non-remote staff to improve the work lives and for its globally distributed staff.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Powered by People

This is a lean, inward-facing research project that surfaced the challenges and highlights of working remotely for the Foundation and offered opportunities for the Foundation and non-remote staff to improve the work lives and for its globally distributed staff.

item.title: Readers’ Perceptions of Desktop Wikipedia
item.description: This study seeks to understand the experience and sentiment of new and casual readers on Wikipedia.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Sentiment & Perception

This study seeks to understand the experience and sentiment of new and casual readers on Wikipedia.

Lead: Daisy Chen, with Hureo and the Readers Web team
item.author: Daisy Chen, with Hureo and the Readers Web team

item.title: Micro-contributions on the Android App
item.description: This research studies the factors that motivate and retain Wikipedia editors who use the section editor tool on the Android app.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Sentiment & Perception

This research studies the factors that motivate and retain Wikipedia editors who use the section editor tool on the Android app.

Lead: Daisy Chen, with the Android team and Robin Schoenbaechler
item.author: Daisy Chen, with the Android team and Robin Schoenbaechler

item.title: Wiki Comparison
item.description: This initiative, lead by Neil Shah-Quinn, established a baseline for comparing key characteristics of 732 wiki projects (number of editors, amount of content, readers, readers by platform, etc).
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Numeric Exploration

This initiative, lead by Neil Shah-Quinn, established a baseline for comparing key characteristics of 732 wiki projects (number of editors, amount of content, readers, readers by platform, etc).

Lead: Neil Shah-Quinn
item.author: Neil Shah-Quinn

item.title: New Page Patrol
item.description: Content integrity on Wikipedia relies on editors who patrol articles and respond to vandalism. This research brings to light the workflows of editors who patrol on Wikipedia(s) and the tools used in the course of their work.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Powered by People

Content integrity on Wikipedia relies on editors who patrol articles and respond to vandalism. This research brings to light the workflows of editors who patrol on Wikipedia(s) and the tools used in the course of their work.

Lead: Jonathan Morgan
item.author: Jonathan Morgan

item.title: Community Health Survey
item.description: An inquiry into the unique challenges faced by volunteer administrators in conflict resolution situations and what types of resources would be most beneficial to this work.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Online Social Behavior

An inquiry into the unique challenges faced by volunteer administrators in conflict resolution situations and what types of resources would be most beneficial to this work.

Lead: Michael Raish, with the Anti-Harassment Tools Team
item.author: Michael Raish, with the Anti-Harassment Tools Team

item.title: IP Masking Impact Report
item.description: An examination of how edits by users who have not logged-in effect administrator workflows.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Online Social Behavior

An examination of how edits by users who have not logged-in effect administrator workflows.

Lead: Claudia Lo, with the Anti-Harassment Tools Team
item.author: Claudia Lo, with the Anti-Harassment Tools Team

item.title: Movement Organizers
item.description: The Movement Organizer Study sought to understand the life cycle of contributors by documenting paths, practices, challenges, and risks faced by successful organizers throughout the Free Knowledge.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Powered by People

The Movement Organizer Study sought to understand the life cycle of contributors by documenting paths, practices, challenges, and risks faced by successful organizers throughout the Free Knowledge.

Lead: Abbey Ripstra, The Community Engagement Team, and Ana Chang of Concept Hatchery
item.author: Abbey Ripstra, The Community Engagement Team, and Ana Chang of Concept Hatchery

item.title: Searching on Commons: Structured Data Across Wikimedia
item.description: This project tests usability of prototypes and captures users’ expectations and desires in their search experiences on the wikis.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Sentiment & Perception

This project tests usability of prototypes and captures users’ expectations and desires in their search experiences on the wikis.

Lead: Daisy Chen, with the Structured Data Team
item.author: Daisy Chen, with the Structured Data Team

item.title: Ethical & Human-Centered AI
item.description: This project identfies challenges and emerging opportunities to leverage AI technologies to further the mission of Wikimedia.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Machine Augmentation

This project identfies challenges and emerging opportunities to leverage AI technologies to further the mission of Wikimedia.

Lead: Jonathan Morgan
item.author: Jonathan Morgan

item.title: Harassment on Arabic Wikipedia
item.description: This study aimed to establish a baseline understanding of the frequency of harassment, trolling, and threatening communicative practices on Arabic Wikipedia, to explore the effects of these practices on editing and community health, and to guide future investigation and strategic decisions for the Anti-Harassment Tools team.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Online Social Behavior

This study aimed to establish a baseline understanding of the frequency of harassment, trolling, and threatening communicative practices on Arabic Wikipedia, to explore the effects of these practices on editing and community health, and to guide future investigation and strategic decisions for the Anti-Harassment Tools team.

Lead: Mike Raish, with the Anti-Harassment Tools Team
item.author: Mike Raish, with the Anti-Harassment Tools Team

item.title: Reporting System Rubric for the Community Health Initiative
item.description: A review of best practices in reporting systems for disputes and abuse across different platforms.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Online Social Behavior

A review of best practices in reporting systems for disputes and abuse across different platforms.

item.title: Steward Spambot Workflow
item.description: An investigation into one of the most common tasks performed by stewards, global locks of suspected spambots that are active across multiple wikis.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Online Social Behavior

An investigation into one of the most common tasks performed by stewards, global locks of suspected spambots that are active across multiple wikis.

Lead: Claudia Lo, with the Anti-Harassment Tools team
item.author: Claudia Lo, with the Anti-Harassment Tools team

item.title: Augmentation
item.description: This is a position piece developed by Wikimedia Foundation to frame the potential of machine-in-the-loop technologies in making all the world's knowledge available to all, and to ensure the process to assemble that knowledge is inclusive, balanced and safe.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Machine Augmentation

This is a position piece developed by Wikimedia Foundation to frame the potential of machine-in-the-loop technologies in making all the world's knowledge available to all, and to ensure the process to assemble that knowledge is inclusive, balanced and safe.

Lead: Wikimedia Foundation, with David Goldberg
item.author: Wikimedia Foundation, with David Goldberg

item.title: Contribution Workflow Taxonomy
item.description: This project details the workflow of contributors and assesses the level of difficulty they encounter with each step in the workflow in order to understand what contributes to editors' retention or burn-out.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Powered by People

This project details the workflow of contributors and assesses the level of difficulty they encounter with each step in the workflow in order to understand what contributes to editors' retention or burn-out.

item.title: New Editor Experiences
item.description: This study sought to understand the experiences, needs and challenges of new editors on midsize Wikipedias with the goal of learning how best to support and retain them.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Powered by People

This study sought to understand the experiences, needs and challenges of new editors on midsize Wikipedias with the goal of learning how best to support and retain them.

Lead: Wikimedia Foundation, with Reboot
item.author: Wikimedia Foundation, with Reboot

item.title: New Readers
item.description: This study sought to understand potential Wikimedia readers in countries where access to the internet is quickly growing.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Powered by People

This study sought to understand potential Wikimedia readers in countries where access to the internet is quickly growing.

Lead: Wikimedia Foundation, with Reboot
item.author: Wikimedia Foundation, with Reboot

item.title: Contribution Taxonomy Project
item.description: This project creates a taxonomy of the contributions made by Wikimedia communities, measure the contributions in that taxonomy, and elicit trends in volunteer contributions to the projects.
item.content:encoded:
Initiative: Powered by People

This project creates a taxonomy of the contributions made by Wikimedia communities, measure the contributions in that taxonomy, and elicit trends in volunteer contributions to the projects.
